histogram.name: WebApk.AppIdentityDialog.PendingImageUpdateDiffValue
histogram.summary: Records how much different the before and after images are during the webapp update process (for non-scaled images only -- see also metric PendingImageUpdateDiffValueScaled). Recorded each time the update process detects an image change, except for instances where the update is still pending when the update process runs again (already approved images).

histogram.name: WebApk.AppIdentityDialog.PendingImageUpdateDiffValueScaled
histogram.summary: Records how much different the before and after images are during the webapp update process, when one of them has been scaled. Recorded each time the update process detects an image change, except for instances where the update is still pending when the update process runs again (already approved images).

histogram.name: WebApk.Database.WriteResult
histogram.summary: Records the write result (boolean) in WebApkDatabase.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.GooglePlayErrorCode
histogram.summary: Records the error code when installing a WebAPK from Google Play fails. See go/webapk-install-googleplayerrorcode.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.GooglePlayInstallResult
histogram.summary: Records whether installing a WebAPK from Google Play succeeded. If not, records the reason that the install failed.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.InstallDuration
histogram.summary: How long it takes to install a WebAPK. The time is measured from the time that the user initiates the install to the time that the Open button is shown in the infobar. This metric is only recorded when install succeeds.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.InstallEvent
histogram.summary: WebAPKs are PWAs wrapped in an Android apk, installed from an app banner or the add to homescreen menu item. This stat tracks WebAPK installation events.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.InstallResult
histogram.summary: Record whether installing a WebAPK succeeded. If not record the reason that the install failed.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.PathToInstall
histogram.summary: Records the path that the user took to reach install point for PWAs. This can be via the Install Modal or the new BottomSheet and may involve the in-product help (IPH) showing. Recorded once per install of a PWA, at the time the PWA is installed.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.RequestTokenDurationV2
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time which has elapsed from the "install infobar showing" to the "install request being sent to Google Play". This time includes the time that it takes to request the WebAPK token and the time that it takes to compute the hashes for the launcher icon and the badge icon.

histogram.name: WebApk.InstallPrompt.SegmentationResult
histogram.summary: When Segmentation Platform returns the install prompt classification result, record an enum for whether the result is invalid, show the prompt, or don't show.

histogram.name: WebApk.Launch.NetworkError
histogram.summary: Records the error codes when a WebAPK is launched with network failures.

histogram.name: WebApk.LaunchFromViewIntent
histogram.summary: Records every WebApk launch attempt originating from a view intent in LaunchIntentDispatcher. A value of "true" indicates a successful launch, while a value of "false" indicates a failure.

histogram.name: WebApk.Notification.Permission.Status2
histogram.summary: When a WebAPK receives a notification, log whether it has permission to display that notification.

histogram.name: WebApk.Notification.PermissionRequestResult
histogram.summary: The result of a WebAPK notification permission request for the purpose of notification delegation. This is logged when the NotificationPermissionUpdater receives the result from the WebApkServiceClient.

histogram.name: WebApk.Session.TotalDuration3{WebApkDistributorType}
histogram.summary: The length of a WebAPK session (launch/foregrounding to backgrounding) in milliseconds. {WebApkDistributorType}

histogram.name: WebApk.ShellApkVersion2{WebApkDistributorType}
histogram.summary: Records WebAPK "Shell APK version" when the WebAPK is launched. The "Shell APK version" is documented in chrome/android/webapk/shell_apk/current_version/current_version.gni {WebApkDistributorType}

histogram.name: WebApk.Startup.Cold.NewStyle.ShellLaunchToSplashscreenVisible
histogram.summary:
Tracks the time to splash screen visible starting from the launch of the WebAPK shell (rather than from the launch of Chrome) for new-style WebAPKs. The WebAPK shell displays the splash screen for new-style WebAPKs.
This is recorded iff: - This is a cold startup of Chrome. - Chrome has not been sent to the background since launch. - There was no recents entry for Chrome (Android replays intents if a recents entry exists), which otherwise adds noise/long-tail to this histogram.

histogram.name: WebApk.Startup.Cold.ShellLaunchToSplashscreenVisible
histogram.summary:
Tracks the time to splashscreen visible starting from the launch of the WebAPK shell (rather than from the launch of Chrome). The splashscreen is shown during postInflationStartup.
This is recorded iff: - This is a cold startup of Chrome. - Chrome has not been sent to the background since launch. - There was no recents entry for Chrome (android replays intents if a recents entry exists), which otherwise adds noise/long-tail to this histogram.

histogram.name: WebApk.Sync.Restore.FetchInstallableData.AppType
histogram.summary: When user selected to restore a WebAPK from sync data, we will try to fetch the installable data from the website. Record the type of the app from the installable check result.

histogram.name: WebApk.Sync.Restore.FetchInstallableData.NotWebApkStatusCode
histogram.summary: When user selected to restore a WebAPK from sync data, we will try to fetch the installable data from the website. If the fetched result is not a valid WebAPK, record the status code from the installable check.

histogram.name: WebApk.Sync.Restore.InstallEvent
histogram.summary: When user selected to restore a WebAPK from sync data, we will try to fetch the installable data from the website. If the fetched result is not installable, we will use the sync data as fallback. Records whether a fallback is used and the reason for using fallback.

histogram.name: WebApk.Sync.Restore.InstallResult.{RestoreType}
histogram.summary: When installing the sync restored WebAPK finished, records a enum for the install result.

histogram.name: WebApk.Sync.SyncedWebApkAddition
histogram.summary: Records additions and modifications to the WebAPK Sync database. In particular, this keeps track of whether the addition is new on the device (vs just a launch of an existing WebAPK) and whether it's new to the Sync database (vs a modification of an existing item). Recorded every time a WebAPK is installed or launched.

histogram.name: WebApk.Sync.SyncedWebApkCount
histogram.summary: Records a count of the number of WebAPKs in the WebAPK Sync database. Recorded when the WebAPK Database is opened, which happens on every Chrome launch on Android.

histogram.name: WebApk.Sync.SyncedWebApkRemovalCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of WebAPKs that get removed from the WebAPK Sync database. Recorded when removing a WebAPK from the Sync database, which happens when an unused WebAPK is uninstalled, or when Chrome is launched on Android when expired WebAPK entries exist in Sync.

histogram.name: WebApk.Uninstall{WebApkDistributorType}
histogram.summary: Records that a WebAPK was uninstalled. {WebApkDistributorType}

histogram.name: WebApk.UniversalInstall.DialogAction
histogram.summary: Records what happens in the Universal Install dialog (dialog opened, app installed, shortcut created, etc). Recorded once per action taken in the dialog.

histogram.name: WebApk.UniversalInstall.DialogShownForAppType
histogram.summary: Records which app type the Universal Install dialog was shown. Recorded once per dialog shown, after we've figured out which type app it is. Note: In versions prior to 125 this metric overcounted app types in scenarios where the dialog redirects to the install dialog (instead of showing) because we detect that only one action was meaningful to the user.

histogram.name: WebApk.UniversalInstall.TimeoutWithAppType
histogram.summary: Records which app types were detected when the Universal Install dialog was shown after timing out. Recorded once per dialog shown, but only if a timeout has occured before figuring out which type app it is.

histogram.name: WebApk.UniversalInstall.{AppType}.AppDataFetchTime
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes (in milliseconds per {AppType}), from the time the dialog is requested until the application data has been fetched. Note that this does not reflect actual time it takes the installability check to finish, because it will run in the background before the dialog starts, and might even have completed before the dialog is requested. Recorded once per dialog (right after the application data becomes available).

histogram.name: WebApk.Update.GooglePlayUpdateResult
histogram.summary: Records whether updating a WebAPK from Google Play succeeded. If not, records the reason that the update failed.

histogram.name: WebApk.Update.NumStaleUpdateRequestFiles
histogram.summary: Records the number of zombie "WebAPK update request" files that the update process failed to cleanup. Recorded for all WebAPKs whenever a WebAPK or webapp is launched.

histogram.name: WebApk.Update.RequestSent
histogram.summary: Records the time point when a request to update a WebAPK is sent to the WebAPK Server.

histogram.name: WebApk.Update.ShellVersion
histogram.summary: When a WebAPK update request was queued, records the current WebAPK's "Shell APK version" The "Shell APK version" is documented in chrome/android/webapk/shell_apk/current_version/current_version.gni

histogram.name: WebApk.Update.UpdateEmptyUniqueId.NeedsUpgrade
histogram.summary: For WebAPK unique ID migration, record whether an update is neede (with non-empty update reason). This only records for the first legacy update that updates the WebAPK from an empty id.

histogram.name: WebApk.WebappRegistry.NumberOfOrigins
histogram.summary: Records number of unique origins for WebAPKs that have been added to WebappRegistry. This is recorded each time on Chrome startup, after the WebappRegistry is initialized.
